name: Hyatt Regency Baltimore

reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights in June 2009. Expectations (and price!) were for a 4 star hotel, but I would rate as a 2.5. The Good: Newly remodeled with great view if you pay for the HarborView rooms, which we did. The Bad: TV did not work, and once it was fixed, limited stations. Radio did not work. Iron was broken and made me late each day. Very poor housekeeping - shower was cleaned only 1 out of the 3 days and floor was not cleaned. Bedding was cleaned only 1 of the 3 days - found articles left in the bed after being made! Food at Bistro Cafe was poor and pricey. Coffee bar was not open as stated - closed when I went at 6:10 AM and at 5:30PM. Workout room was suppose to be open 24 hrs, but found it locked and was told it's closed Fri & Sat nights??? The visitor information they provided was wrong and ended up going to the Visitors Center across the street. Cost to use Internet, when I get it free at Hilton Garden Inn! Next time you will find me at the Marriott or Hilton.
reviews.title: This is NOT a 4 Star hotel!!

reviews.text: I liked this hotel, it was extremely noisy though- I couldnt sleep a wink when I was on level 6 because of the terrible terrible acoustics from the bar and the ensuiing hoovering and cleaning of the hotel. The reception staff moved me to a fabulous king room on level 12 overlooking the harbour , it was wonderful except it had no bath which I was disappointed about. The staff were really very nice and I had great room service, not too pricey. I would recommend not staying on levels up to level 6 as there is a ceiling that traps all the noise in from the open plan hotel. The conference rooms were average and you could barely hear our speakers for the noise in the room next door. The business centre was incredibly expensive. I had to pay for WiFi in my room which I think is ridiculous. Food was very average.
reviews.title: Great Location, ok hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Allison at the front desk set the stage for the rest of our stay. We had a wonderful experience and will stay again.
reviews.title: excellent location, excellent service, excellent value...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hyatt inner harbor. Our room which was club level was perfect with a perfect view and well worth the money.
reviews.title: Above and beyond!

reviews.text: The front desk was not only friendly but helpful in every way.
reviews.title: Great location, but uninspiring
Dirty, dated, noisy-3 night stay
reviews.text: I arrived at the hotel and used the computer lobby check in and was given a room on the 4th floor above the bar, back to the desk. Then off I went to the 9th floor to a room where the safe was locked. Security did unlock the safe. The rooms are dated, the rugs are worn and dirty. The couches and chairs are stained. The bathroom has been updated and is nice. They do not give you enough towels. Do not expect toilet paper or cups to be replaced, you will have to get them yourself from the cart. The bed and pillows are OK. The parking is disgusting and next to the hotel and smells like urine. The Baltimore area has some nice restaurants but is not the safest neighborhood, notice all the police officers patrolling. Lastly, if anyone walks by your room or is talking you will hear them and I have found this to be true of all Hyatts.
I am normally a Hilton person, so this was a first in a while back at a Hyatt, which was due to the conference I was attending.
reviews.title: Nice location, friendly staff, fine biz hotel

reviews.text: GOOD
reviews.title: A great stay

reviews.text: - Nice location right off the waterfront (note, not ON the waterfront, as you have to cross a street or use the connected bridge walk). Upper floors have nice view of the harbor.
reviews.title: Great location for the inner harbor

reviews.text: - Staff were all very friendly.
reviews.title: Great location
Otakon
reviews.text: I took my daughter for Otakon last year and it was a wonderful hotel. I am staying again this year. It was clean and we had a beautiful view.

if you are looking for a wonderful staff and accomodating staff in one of the best locations in Baltimore, then please stay here. the rooms are business and leisure friendly and the location is very convenient for restaurants and various downtown baltimore harbor sites. the harbor is available using a skywalk inside the hotel and is the pavillion with shops and eateries is right outside the hotel. you do not even need to cross the street. I am glad we chose this hotel for our conference.
reviews.title: Wonderful location and incredibly helpful staff.

reviews.text: I had stayed at the Hyatt Regency, Inner Harbor, Baltimore, MD on the weekend of July 3 - July 5, 2010, and it was a fabulous stay. I was upgraded to a Regency Club King Water View room. When I walked into my room and I saw the Inner Harbor right across the street, I just couldn't believe what a gorgeous view! The heat and humidity were pretty bad that weekend......100 degrees. I chose to go back to my room after dinner on July 4th to view the fireworks right from my room. The view was breathtaking; spectacular; wonderful......I was actually talking to myself out loud saying "oohhhhh and aahhhhhhh".
reviews.title: Another great stay at Hyatt Regency Inner Harbor

reviews.text: All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Everyone always had a smile on their face.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay so much that I made reservations for the weekend of August 7 - August 9, 2010.
reviews.title: In the Heart of the Inner Harbor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This time I had a King Water View room. Once again, the view was breathtaking. It was so nice to be able to see what was happening right at the Pavillions and the water without having to leave my room.
reviews.title: Not a four Star Hotel

reviews.text: First of all, they booked me into a corner room that is so small, I could not believe it. I had to call down to have my room moved. I had no hot water to take a shower. There were kids running down the floors constantly, having races, being very loud. The food & Service at the Pisces lounge is TERRIBLE!!! And VERY over priced!! I'll never stay there again.
reviews.title: Good Location, Horrible Hotel
I'm soooo Tired
reviews.text: I checked in recently to what seemed like an upscale lobby and was excited at the prospect of a comfortable stay. Unfortunately my excitement was short lived when the front desk informed me that they were going through renovations and the Health Club was closed and that there was a chance of sporadic water availability. When I went to my room it was very tired and the hallway was trashed. I decided to take a walk over to the Renaissance to see if they had a room and the hotel is spotless and the location is as good as it get to the harbor. As it turns out they had room so I went back to the Hyatt and checked out. I told them nicely my concerns and they were very nice about releasing me from my reservation. It's as if they totally inderstood where I was coming from. As it turns out the Renaissance was great and the same price. I understand that from time to time renovations are necessary but this place was way too over the hill to be understanding.

reviews.title: Worn, Warm and Friendly
reviews.text: Paid $120 for two nights over weekend thanks to Priceline. Check-in, check-out very nice and with just a little cajoling (and mentioning the fact that I was a Hyatt rewards card holder - who left his card home!) we were able to get a great harbor view room for no extra charge. The location is very good.

The hotel is neat & clean but looking a little worn. The bed was comfortable, the linens nice and the bath was clean and was a pleasure to use. Nothing to rave about, but no complaints. Valet parking is only $5 more a night but in an earlier trip to Baltimore the valet dinged my car on two consecutive days and... it ended up that I never got paid for either one (the valet service is a seperate company from the hotel). So we don't use valet when in Baltimore. The next-door parking is close by and with the hotel pass you can come and go as you please.
reviews.title: needs some work

reviews.text: TIP - for those new to Baltimore, the food in Harborplace across the street is not too good and not too cheap (and we've tried them all!) but Little Italy is a few minutes by car (ask at the desk) and there are plenty of Great Places there. Also, the Hyatt on-site restaurant is good but not great and very pricey,but with a great view. If you aren't counting your pennies you'll like it "okay". We did the Sunday brunch -- good but not destination good.
reviews.title: Conveniently Located, but.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice stylish hotel with excellent view. Close to harbour and nightlife.
reviews.title: Great place and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was there for a long weekend getaway. The woman at the front desk upgraded us to a special deluxe room with water view. Let me tell you, the room was amazing!!! It was a corner room with floor to ceiling glass on two sides and we can view the harbor and the financial district and the galleria mall across the street. The view was absolutely stunning. The hotel is beautiful and classy and very close to everything within Inner Harbour. The only downside is the expensive parking but its expected since its such a classy hotel in the middle of a major city. Parking on the streets is hard so its worth the price. It was about $20 a day but I forget. Overall, the hotel is beautiful as there is nothing less expected from Hyatts.
reviews.title: One of the nicest hotels I've been to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hyatt in Baltimore this weekend. The room was wonderful, with great linens, immaculate and a wonderful king size bed. Our view was incredible overlooking the Inner Harbor. Gorgeous at night. The food was very good in the Bistro Restaurant. Nce staff throughout the hotel, friendly and thoughtful. We loved the huge glass window in our room with a long window seat for two. You both can either sit there to enjoy the Inner Harbor activity, rest or read. Great location for Little Italy and Fells Point, where there is plenty of activity in the small little bars and restaurants. We used the water taxi to go to various locations. Great fun.
reviews.title: Great Mini Vacation

reviews.text: Excellent location overlooking the harbour area. Stunning hotel externally with dark glass covering the outside walls.
reviews.title: Good location but noisy

reviews.text: Service was patchy with the concierge one of the best around but the serving staff at breakfast disinterested. Food at breakfast was just average.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I heard sirens all night long. Guests were loud also. Parking was pricey.
reviews.title: Not a quiet hotel

reviews.text: I loved this hotel even though I came here for a single night. The rooms were modern and I loved the elevators!!! You should really come here.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pricelined the room, so we got a good price, but it also meant that we got a double bed instead of a king and we faced the convention center instead of the harbor. The room was clean and nicely decorated, although the tub is too small for romance. The location is perfect for any exploration of the harbor or downtown areas, and we walked to nearby restaurants and used the water taxi, purchasing tickets at the visitors center across the street. Parking is expensive at $27 a night, and someone broke one of our taillights while the car was there, but that's life in the big city I guess. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant, only because we got out of the room so late and were too hungry to find a spot elsewhere; also an expensive affair but unsurprising. As a hotel, it is very good. As a value, it might be worth it to pay more to stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
Beware
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt because it was the only hotel I found in the inner-harbor that had a pool. The pool was run-down, and the poolside drink/snack cabana was closed the day I visited (although the weather was perfect. maybe they were understaffed?).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was a breeze, and the woman that helped us was so sweet. BEWARE: I just checked my online banking information and discovered that I was billed twice. Visa informed me that I'll have to wait for my bill to appear, and then I'll have to manually fill out a form and send it in to dispute the charge (may not seem like a big deal, but I love the ease of doing things online, so this makes me a little cranky).
reviews.title: Would stay here again
Pleasant Stay, Friendly Staff
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights as a getaway weekend. We had never been to Baltimore and enjoyed our visit. The Hyatt staff was very friendly and helpful, always saying hello in the halls and lobby and offering assistance whenever we needed it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on the Regency Club level, which was the same price as a regular room for the nights we stayed. The club has 24-hour access to water, juice, coffee. There was also a small but adequate evening snack and drink service.
reviews.title: Not What I Expected By Any Means

reviews.text: We had reservations one night at Roys which has a complimentary shuttle that will pick you up since it is a little too far to walk. A truly pleasant surprise was that when we ordered dessert, the restaurant said it was compliments of the Hyatt. We did not expect that and it really added to our stay.
reviews.title: great location, very nice hotel, lots of extra charges

reviews.text: There was construction in the area, so getting to the hotel was not very easy, but that is not the fault of the Hyatt. We also found a great jazz night at the Wine Cellar which was only a few minutes walk.
reviews.title: Super rooms

reviews.text: We really loved our stay and will definitely return, both to Baltimore and the Hyatt.
reviews.title: Great location and great service!!

reviews.text: We stayed here for a one night stop over to catch an Orioles game. It is ideally placed for that, within walking distance of the stadium, and on game days there are a lot of people around, so it felt quite safe. There is a good sized car cark next to the hotel, and self parking is not a problem. Check in was quick and the rooms clean and ok for one night. The hotel is a little noisy and breakfast was poor to average but no waits. The only real negative was the bath which was so shallow that it could only really be used as a shower.
reviews.title: OK for a stop over

reviews.text: Ok for one night, but don't expect luxury.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Took my Wife and 2 small kids to the Hyatt Regency from 8/21-8/23. Couldn't ask for a better hotel. The location was perfect, the staff was polite and efficient. Had a small issue with the people in the room next to us arguing and the Hotel handled it perfect. They compensated us for the issue with a coupon for 2 adult to the breakfast buffet. Can't blame the hotel for people like were next to us but you can hold them responsible for how they handle it and we couldn't ask for a better response on their part. Will definetly be stay there again
reviews.title: Great Room and Location, just minor hiccups with service
Wonderful Place to stay - Ideal location
reviews.text: I stayed here 2 nights in the middle of August 2009. The location on the inner harbor is fantastic, you can walk right out to all the action via a skybridge from the 2nd floor of the hotel lobby. I booked the Hyatt Business plan which included free internet access, breakfast, a newspaper, and one free pressed shirt per day. This also seemed to put me up on the club level, so if you plan to buy these things separately, this might be a good option. Also, they inadvertently set up the connecting suite living room for me, even though I did not book that, but then said it's OK, enjoy it when I called the front desk to make sure of my room. Sweet!

Note that the free breakfast is not for room service. There is a coffee shop on the 2nd floor of the lobby too. The only goofs I had was that my hotel keys kept erasing themselves though I kept them away from my cell phone, and on day of checkout (early, 630am) they didn't manage to bring me my in-room breakfast before I left. The guy at the front desk had nodded off when I went down to check out (ok he had been up all night) but then comped my daily parking in the garage for the inconvenience with the breakfast, which was nice. Nothing went wrong which would prevent me from staying there again, loved the place. Oh and the bed/linens/bathroom were spa-like, modern, and comfortable.
reviews.title: Wonderful but NOISY

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hyatt for two days. The location as others have said is great. The hotel I am sure when first built was amazing - It needs attention now.
reviews.title: Rooms need attention

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I used to be a maid a resort and am therefore very picky about the details that make a difference. We walked on the room was warm and musty
reviews.title: Rooms are nice, but that's about it.

reviews.text: We stayed for two days with the AC set to 60 and the room was only comfortable at night - when we weren't moving around. This was disappointing since is was 100 degrees out.
reviews.title: Another Hyatt Gem

reviews.text: We booked on priceline and charged $30 more a day for a king bed and Harbor view. If I had know that I would have bid higher with the hope a getting a newer hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but bring own pack and play

reviews.text: The pool is postage stamp size. When we went to look out the window at the view in our room - the settee was stained
reviews.title: great hotel at a beautiful location

reviews.text: A highlight of this hotel is the service and attentiveness of the staff. Everyone is extremely helpful, courteous, and pleasant. They do not wait for you to ask for help but instead offer assistance first. We paid almost $300 a night for over 10 rooms and you would think we would get some extras. No internet service provided. They wanted to charge an outrageous fee per person. No screen for the conference room - an extra charge. The rooms were fine but nothing special. Carpeting was stained in areas, a few markings on the wall. But the room was comfortable and a good size.
reviews.title: Wonderful service but expect to pay for everything

reviews.text: We stayed @Hyatt Regency for a night before out trip to DC. This hotel is in a beautiful, accessible location to the Inner Harbor. Also, we cannot stop talking about the customer service (150%) in this hotel!!! Staff was extremely helpful and w more than willing to facilitate our stay!!! Words cannot describe our satisfaction at this hotel!
reviews.title: Excellent!!!!!!

reviews.text: I stayed here for a conference at the convention center in June, as was very impressed with the service at this hotel. The location is very convenient to everything (Harbor, Camden Yards and the Convention Center). Though not much to look at from the exterior, once inside it is very clean and current. The rooms are nice with comfortable beds, good sized bathrooms and are very quiet. A sample of toothpaste was left along with the usual amenities which was a nice touch. The general manager introduced herself to me in the elevator and I found the staff overall to be very gracious. When I arrived there was a long line to check in and a bellman was helpful in assisting me with the automated check in, which was very speedy. Lastly upon check out there was a dining room charge that was not mine on the invoice, when I went to the front desk it was removed, no questions asked with a smile.
reviews.title: Great service a good choice for business travellers

reviews.text: This hotel worked out perfectly for my business traveling spouse and me who was a tourist. It is located near the central business district as well as the Inner Harboe which is home to several tourist attractions. It is also walking distance to Camden Yards, so I was able to catch a game as well.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in good location

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious enough and the bathroom is large. We had a room facing the Inner Harbor so it was quiet with a lovely view.
reviews.title: Great View, Great Service

reviews.text: Good: Great location for the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. Hotel itself was very nice.
reviews.title: Good and Not so Good

reviews.text: Not so Good: The room could have been cleaner. We had several spots on the carpets and the mini bar wouldn't open. We told someone about it but no one came to open it. At the Bistro, my son had a bug fly into his drink. It was quickly replaced, but still a turn off. It's the Hyatt Regency. We just expect more. I never felt comfortable in the room. I know that when we check in to a hotel that many people have stayed there before us, but I don't like feeling that way when I am there, and I did. We have stayed at Hyatts before, and are gold club members, but this left us a little disappointed. Also, a very weak shower. Felt like I was in the rain instead of under a shower. Hyatt can do better.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Rooms and Views.....Amazing Staff

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Hyatt on the Inner Harbor. I was there this past weekend and was blown away. I was a little concerned after reading some of the other reviews, but my experience was great. From the moment I arrived I was greeted with smiles. The lobby was very busy and it appeared to be a line to check in. It took less than 5 minutes and I was greeted with more smiles by the front desk. Within in moments I was on my way to my room which had a great view of the pool and the harbor and even a little of Camden Yard.....I loved it! I went to the pool to catch some sun and they had a bar AND a tv with the World Cup games playing....this blew my mind! I was so excited that I could still listen to the game that I thought I was sacrificing for a tan!
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: I live in Maryland, but will be looking for another get away soon and will definitely choose the Hyatt!
reviews.title: No more Hyatts in my future

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is very good. It is on the inner harbour. Many attractions are situated in the close by area, just a few minutes walk away.
reviews.title: Convenient
Great view of the Inner Harbor
reviews.text: If you want a great view of the harbor, then the Hyatt Regency is just for you. The view is amazing both in the daytime and at night. Some of the sights that you’ll see include the aquarium, the Rusty Scupper Restaurant, and the USS Constellation. The rooms are very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. One of the perks is that Harbor Place is a short walk from the hotel. There is a walkway that connects the hotel to the mall so crossing Light Street is a breeze. Because of the great location, you pretty much have everything the Inner Harbor has to offer right at your fingertips. The Hyatt also has a restaurant, Bistro 300, located right inside. It is very convenient and has an excellent breakfast selection. This hotel is definitely my favorite hotel on the Inner Harbor. I’ve stayed there several times, and I’ve never had a complaint.

Unfortunately, I believe most of the money you pay for staying at this hotel goes toward keeping the lobby in a fashionable state, because it certainly doesn't go toward keeping up the rooms (at least the standard rooms). We recently stayed from Aug. 15-17th for a little mini-vacation and were a little disappointed with the room. It was nice and cool, a definite plus, but it could have been cleaner. There was a lot of dust in places (hair dryer and towel cabinet) and the furniture was quite chipped and just not nice for a hotel considered to be 4-star. There was nasty, I don't what, in a crevice behind the door by the shower and the caulking around the sink in the bathroom was not very clean. Even though I got the room for $150 on Priceline, I did expect more!
reviews.title: Hopeful, but disappointed...

reviews.text: I rented a room at the Hyatt to celebrate the "one year" anniversary of dating my partner and was pretty disappointed.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: This review will cover several topics: hotel, family activities, food, recommendations, for the inner harbor area. We stayed at this location due to attending a conference, so it was a mixed business and family trip. The hotel location is very good, direcetly accross from the inner harbor, with a secluded walkway over the expressway. We flew into BWI and took the light rail, which made it easy and cheap. At check-in, we had a delightful surprise > "homemade cookies". (I don't know if they were actually homemade, but they tasted like they were). We also discovered the Amtrak from the inner harbor to DC-Union Station, which was a good side trip to Capitol Hill. We also visited Ft. McHenry via water taxi > leave plenty of time to see the sights, take a tour, then return trip (ours was the last off the dock, and they were at capacity >>add another 45 min!). The location of the hotel is their best asset > rooms were good, baths were very good, meals were OK. We had a nice walk around the inner harbor and found an amazing restaurant > The Rusty Scupper. We visited them 3 times over the span of 3 days, and enjoyed the views, meals, and the very friendly waiter (ex-Navy, extra tall, fun with the kids, with great stories and recommendations). The fitness center was a fun visit for the kids: they have a unique upstairs sauna contained within the fitness room. One small drawback at the hotel was the Homecoming events held in the ballrooms downstairs coincided with our stay. It was crowded, noisey, and high schoolers Everywhere... To sum up: Great Location, Wonderful Treats, short walk to train station/ballpark/inner harbor/Ft. McHenry/etc; I would recommend this hotel for these reasons (plus the discounted rate did hurt either).
reviews.title: Great Location, with treats, is their best asset

reviews.text: We used to live in Baltimore and I was initially a little disappointed when I found out we were staying at the Hyatt because it used to be 'tired' when we lived there. What a surprise - we were tired from driving when we arrived and were greeted by Jazmin (sp?) at the front desk who swiftly told us she was giving us a corner room with two double beds and do we want a rollaway? (complimentary!) Then she gave our kids passes for free ice cream - this was a huge hit. The room was large, pleasant, clean and dramatic with floor-to-ceiling window walls which extended into the bathroom. The beds were comfortable. The location of the hotel is front and center at the Harbor. The common areas are minimal, but pleasant and comfortable and the rooftop pool is very nice. Another thing we noticed was the consistently friendly and service-oriented staff. We will definitely seek a stay in this Hyatt again!
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.text: This was a nice hotel, great location for baltimore, you can walk right over the sky bridge and go to inner harbor restraunts and shops. It has a shop and nice size lobby. fun elevator, dinner at there restraunt on second level was good, nothing special. The room was a little small for my liking.
reviews.title: great location, nice hotel

reviews.text: Recently we reserved a room on the hyatt web site and since we were Diamond members we used one of our suite upgrades. Arriving at we were give a suite on the sixth floor and the only view was a massive gravel roof. So much for status. . Initially we had asked for a harbor view but they pay no attention to requests and the room assigning person does not look at status or requests. After 1 1/2 hours waiting we were finally given our room which was a small suite with a semi harbor view. Which was fine. The next day the fun started. You have to have your key to get up in the elevators and I forgot mine MY BAD! I went to the desk and asked for a new one. The front desk clerk Adam said since the room was in my husbands name i could not have a new key made even with id. He should of sent someone up with me and i could verify something in the room but he just said no and that i would have to wait until my husband came from his conference at 6 o'clock and 4 blocks away to get into the room to get in the room. .. Be prepared to have the clerks be totally unhelpful and our right obstructionists! . Finally after a temper fit the manager was called and he said it was ok to give me a new key. It was my mistake to leave the key in the room but it should have been resolved like most hotels do it . #1 The first key didn't work in the lounge which is nice to get water and cokes.. #2 I went back down and got the key re-keyed. It didn't work in the door to the room. #3 Went back down and re-keyed again. which didn't work in one of the doors. #4 Found a helpful supervisor and she took keys down and a manger finally came up with the re-keyed re-keyed re-keyed keys.. #5 Husband has old key and since their keying system stinks I will have to go down again to get him up in the elevator and into room.. So if you want to spend your vacation hunting keys and not getting into a room this is the place for you.
reviews.title: FORGET THE TROUBLE.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean, but we weren't happy to have 2 double beds.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but pricey

reviews.text: Stayed here on a recent business trip to Baltimore. While the office I was visiting was far from central Baltimore, wanted to stay in the Inner Harbour area as I'd never been to the City. The hotel is extremely well located, within walking distance of just about anything you'd want to see in the Inner Harbour area. While everything was clean and staff was extremely courteous and helpful, the hotel had a worn out, tired look to it. I just recently visited a friend who was staying at a Hyatt in my home city and got the same impression. Don't know if there's a pattern there, but at least with the two I've visited recently, seems like Hyatts need some serious updating.
reviews.title: Great location, needs updating

reviews.text: Room was large, clean with a nice bathroom although I found the amenities a little thin. Walls were on the thin side---could hear conversation of family with kids next door. I hate adjoining room doors in any hotel room and my room had one but it was well secured. Given proximity to the National Aquarium, there seemed to be lots of families with lots of kids and the hallways were somewhat loud at times. Not the hotels fault, but perhaps they could have a quiet floor for those who are on work, rather than a pleasure trip.
reviews.title: Amazing trip for our family

reviews.text: Also on the negative side----the coffee maker had missing parts. I didn't bother calling the front desk but this shouldn't happen at any hotel. The tv, while nice, big flat screen, was thin on channels, except for all types of ESPN channels you would ever want. Room service was excellent in both delivery time, service and quality of food.
reviews.title: Okay hotel, great location

reviews.text: I booked through Priceline and paid $75 per night so absolutely no complaints as to price and overall, happy with the hotel. However, if I wasn't booking through Priceline, not sure I'd choose the Hyatt. There are many other hotels in the area which look a lot fresher.
reviews.title: Beatiful room and view! Friendly Staff

reviews.text: I have never written a review before but this hotel was so amazing that I just had to. We stayed for 2 nights at the Hyatt Regency at Inner Harbor and got a "Harbor View" room. The staff made us feel like we were family. It is a safe, secure, clean and absolutely gorgeous hotel. We went with our 8 and 10 year old and they just loved it. Our view was breathtaking. There is a sky walk over the highway so you never have to even deal with crossing a street and with your room sitting above the buildings the view of the water and all the happenings is very clear. Street performers all day and into the evening that are free and perform for tips. High security all around so it is safe. Water taxi takes you all around. There are 3 different kids' museums within blocks and countless restaurants. A mall full of interesting shops is right next door. I had to pay a little more for this hotel but it was so worth it with the harbor view. Wait until you get in the elevator! I would do it all over! Count on spending more than what you are used to for area eating. It's an expensive location. And if you're on a budget, bring a little cooler to put left overs or snacks/drinks in. There is a fridge but it is stocked with hotel drinks and snacks. ($5.30 for a bottle of water!) Even if you just splurge and go overnight it is worth it!
reviews.title: beautiful room, but the extra's sink the value

description: Nestled in the heart of downtown, this AAA Four-Diamond Inner Harbor hotel offers a luxury gateway to this enchanting waterfront town. Catch an Orioles’ game at Camden Yards, crack crabs in the Inner Harbor, or explore the wonders of the sea at the National Aquarium. Take advantage of modern meeting venues within our hotel in Baltimore Inner Harbor - just steps from the Convention Center.
